meanings.definition: The state or condition of being lobulated.
meanings.sent1: The lobulations of the brain help with its functions.
meanings.sent2: The doctor noticed the lobulations in the X-ray of the patient's lungs.
meanings.sent3: The lobulations on the potato made it look like a tiny mountain range.
meanings.sent4: Her heart felt like it had tiny lobulations, each beat a separate peak.
meanings.sent5: The lobulations of the coral reef were teeming with colorful fish.

meanings.definition: The presence of lobes or rounded projections.
meanings.sent1: The lobulations on the leaf made it stand out from the others.
meanings.sent2: The lobulations of the rock formation were fascinating to the geologists.
meanings.sent3: The lobulations on the cake made it resemble a miniature castle.
meanings.sent4: The lobulations of the clouds in the sky created a beautiful pattern.
meanings.sent5: The lobulations of the seashell were delicate and intricate.
